comments:
Start a debug session (say, with GDB). Open the Register View and highlight any register. Then on every refresh of the Register View (say, do a stepping, or just switch to another view and then come back to register view), you will get error dialog with "Restore view state" as title and "Error" as message.

Here's the snippet from my .log file:
-------------
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.registers.RegistersViewerState.decodePath(RegistersViewerState.java:77)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.AbstractViewerState.restoreState(AbstractViewerState.java:145)
-------------

And this bug seems related to bug #95477 
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=95477

Looks like a dup of bug 115411, which is fixed in 3.1.2 (soon to be released).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 115411 ***
